The new rent seekers are the technology companies in earnest now realistically control much of the way societies think and interact as well as the way global finance interacts with consumers and businesses. A great critique of the promise of blockchain and digital coins and how they were usurped by con artists and the dream of decentralisation way just a parting dream. It’s a sorrow tale for left who dreamed of a post capitalist rebirth of the socialist system. That is dead the power now more than ever resides in the hands of tech bros and fewer nation states to set the rule of the future. I appreciate that he gives a remedy to this at the end, with a independent revolutionary concept, worth exploring, the conditioning of all us will be at war with the desire for change someday I hope. A great contribution to a topic not really discussed today and one I hope sees other expand on.

Audible.title: One of my Top 3 Apps- BUT...
Audible.body: I love my Audible App & use it daily. There really is something incredibly special & satisfying about hearing your favourite stories brought to vivid life by a talented narrator. My job involves spending all day looking at a computer screen so my eyes struggle to cope with the added strain of reading on top of work- my audible app means I can still emerge myself in so many of the literary worlds I love.My ONE complaint? Since the last 2-3 versions have been released, sometimes I can’t get newly purchased books to download. REALLY annoying. Most of the time (90-95%) I just wait a day or so & the problem fixes itself. Once or twice now I’ve had to delete the App, shut down my phone & then RE-install the App again once I’ve turned my iPhone back on. This seems to be a recurring theme in a lot of the most recent reviews- wish they would fix whatever bug it is, because otherwise this App is the best thing to happen to my ability to keep reading for enjoyment in a long, long time!

Audible.title: Great but some tweaks required
Audible.body: 1) Need an option to stop seeing certain books. I will never buy a book from Michelle Obama, Will Smith, or Prince Harry so please give me an option to say not interested and for these to no longer be displayed.  2) Daily deals are great and I have bought a bunch however they are more often than not completely irrelevant. Given the large number of books on Audible there are bound to be more customised options available  3) I am often interested in series which are very old like Clive Cusslers Dirk Pitt, Wilbur Smith’s Courtney’s, Tom Clancy’s Jack Ryan’s. All of these titles cost the same as a new book even though many are decades old and no longer on the best sellers list. I, and many others, would be tempted to buy whole series at a discount or buy one at full price and the rest 50% off, or 2 for a credit.4) Last but not least. I am not one bit interested in LGBT or Australian Aboriginal literature. Many of my favourite books have characters or content which deals with these however it is not front and centre. How Audible pushes books with a pure focus on this content on their clients I find frustrating and reprehensible. Your role is to provide compelling content to all of your clients not force fringe content, relevant to a few, on everyone in an transparent effort to appear progressive and righteous.

Audible.title: AMAZING
Audible.body: This app is used 24/7 by me, as someone who can’t just fall asleep with silence, I need something to listen to, and for me trying new podcasts are always so hard because I am so used to the other ones that I listen to. But when I first found a book to listen to, I thought that it was like amazing I was like I actually like this, and that’s weird for me because I don’t normally like new things I don’t really like change so that was actually a really good thing to discover because now I can try new books whenever I get sick of one book then I can go and listen to another podcast or another book. Although I would say sometimes when I’m trying to skip or back it doesn’t let me so that’s one downside but otherwise this app is amazing. Another thing to mention is that if you want to get a monthly ticket or credit to use for a book or podcast you should do it. It’s quite cheap and it actually works and it’s actually pretty good to do because it some of the books that are already free on Audible they don’t normally they aren’t that good in my opinion so I would suggest highly buying the monthly credit thing.

Audible.title: Tuesday with Maurie
Audible.body: I really enjoy to listening to this and I have read the book and I am not really a person that reads so the aublile books and podcasts are really good for me l have listened to several autobiography and enjoy them some better than others and I always seem to have a break from them and then I go back to them that is just a personal thing listening to Tuesday with Maurie and I watch the film was something a friend got she was only in forties it’s a horrible disease and watching some one go through it is hard to watch how it effects them I found I could relate with some of the ways as it was just like the things my friend went through let’s hope some day a will find a way that it will prolong a person’s life as I don’t know if they will ever find a cure well not in my life time but once upon a time you rarely heard of it but  now you see more people with it and I can relate when I see them as I watched my friend fight the disease and eventually losing the battle with it

Audible.title: A relatable life story
Audible.body: Selma Blair, you have such a relatable story to so many women of my generation and (I’m sure) for every generation before and to follow. I saw myself in you in so many ways… childhood innocence, navigating teenagerdom, the vulnerabilty, relationships and all the lessons that come with it all. Highlighting to us all that we never stop learning and relearning throughout our lives. As an actor who has grown up parallel to me, I never realised that you were actually growing up in front us all, experiencing such similar anxieties, anguishes and adversities that we all face.You have emerged like a butterfly with such grace and composure… The message I have taken away from your story is to keep going and keep growing and learning, despite what is thrown at us in this crazy old world.The best part about listening to your story on Audible is that YOU told the story to me… straight from the horses mouth. With all of the raw emotion, laughter and tears. Thank you, and please keep writing… it really is your true calling. 🙏❤️

Audible.title: Everyone must read this book
Audible.body: This book changed my life. Bessel gave me so much hope as a trauma sufferer also dealing with addiction and mental health issues. He shared a variety of proven and successful avenues for healing trauma outside of western medicine practices. The psychiatric industry has been failing us greatly and is keeping us sick and at risk. This book gives us agency by providing so many solution based approaches which are holistic and gentle on our bodies and minds. Rather than provide Band-Aid solutions which never deal with the issues at hand he provided insight into how to address the cause of our suffering by leaning in and provided strategic approaches to taking our healing into our own hands no matter where we are in our lives. This has lead me down a new healing journey after years of searching and has given me so much inspiration into new ways of. healing myself in more effective ways that promote growth rather than quash who I am with medications that don’t work.

Audible.title: More credits
Audible.body: I have been using audible for nearly a year now and I can say it has without a doubt opened my mind up to another universe that I hadn’t known about til now, I highly recommend it to anyone who loves books but either doesn’t have the time to physically read them or even has issues concentrating on reading print like myself. This app has changed my life I recommend it to all of my friends regularly and with the subscription you get a new book each month. One suggestion I would have for the makers is possibly adding an option to buy credits in bulk for cheaper prices, sometimes I want to read a new series of books but find myself not wanting to waste credits/$15 on books between 5-10 hours as I can finish that in a day or so, if I had the option to buy more in one go I wouldn’t find myself skipping series that have shorter books at the beginning. Aside from that it’s basically flawless in my eyes, keep up the good work guys!

Audible.title: Wish there was a percentage number
Audible.body: I adore Audible, it’s kinda expensive but the selection is unprecedented. It’s so great for encouraging more reading, as you can multitask while consuming a story. I love how there is brand new and popular books on here, and you also don’t have to wait like you might on Libby. In terms of the app, I wish you could purchase through the app. I wish that you could change the timer to view the percentage you were through the book, and that the overall progress timer was visible on books that were loaded in 2 parts. Finally, I wish that there were cost effective subscriptions for multiple books per month as I read maybe 2 audiobooks a week and find that Audible gets expensive so I rotate between this, Libby (which is connected to your library card, meaning that it’s free BUT they will only have a certain amount of copies of a book and you need to wait until a copy is available - like a normal library book - which can be loooong with new or popular books but has a STUNNING app interface that I believe is more intuitive than Audible), and less frequently I’ll listen to Scribd but the selection is average compared to either of the first two I choose and the app isn’t as pleasant as even Audible. Overall, I love Audible because of the range and I would keep it purely based off of that however I also enjoy the interface and the experience of the books. Overall, I

Audible.title: Good service, Bad support
Audible.body: Audible was reasonably good while I was using it though some would argue a bit on the pricey side. It’s a good service if you can’t find time to read yourself or just need to relax and listen to a book. If you try and cancel the service, boy are you in for a rough ride. For a start you can’t do this via the mobile app and have to go through their website. When you do eventually find the section and go through with it, there are no guarantees that you won’t continue to be billed. I cancelled and despite my membership saying it’s not active now as well as a confirmation email I was still charged at the end of the following month. Cancelled 21st Feb, membership officially ended on the 3rd of March I believe and then charged again on the 31st. You go through their first call option which is some sort of online call (after fighting disheartened through more roundabouts of help options) and the call just cancels after a few minutes of waiting, repeatedly. Try the toll free number and well guess what, it says it is not currently active!!! Classic scam warning signs but Audible isn’t a scam. I cancelled cause I don’t have a job now but I’m waiting to see whether some of my food money will disappear at the end of this month if I get charged again. Not happy!!

Audible.title: Life by Keith Richards
Audible.body: The hilarious opening chapter sets the feel and themes of what’s to follow and left me shaking my head incredulously. Keith can clearly spin a great yarn. Rich descriptions of his childhood in Dartford, detailed a seeming no man’s land of post war Britain trying to find its way from the old to the new. Keith’s guiding lights were the Chicago blues artists, who faded in and faded out across the Atlantic airways through the antennae of his transistor radio. Together with the influence of his musical family, and a chance meeting with Mick Jagger (who lived in a posher part of town) a partnership was forged that became the Rolling Stones. Keith rambles at times, yet he rambles with a fierce hearted loyalty and insight into the populace of musicians, women, staff and personalities, who came and went from his life; some of whom who also shaped the face of the sixties and seventies. It’s a gripping tale. I loved hearing Keith speak himself - such a rich, gravelly and warm voice - a welcome relief from the monotony of Depp’s narration and the south London accented overkill of the second narrator.

Audible.title: A fantastic non-behavioralist, social justice parenting book
Audible.body: Parenting Beyond Power is awesome! If you are looking for ways to ‘be the change you want to see in the world’ and ‘treat others the way you would like to be treated’ here is an great parenting manual for finding ways to do just that, starting in your home.This audiobook brings together the key elements of NVC, collaborative problem solving, unconditional parenting and social justice parenting in a beautifully presented, easy to understand way.I recommend this book to every parent, it truly has something to offer everyone. If you wish to parent differently to how you were parented, this book will help you tread your own path. If you were parented in a respectful way that aligns with your values this book will provide insight into why it can STILL be hard to let go of 'power over' parenting in times of stress. If you currently parent in an authoritarian way this book provides solid research based reasons to consider the alternatives. Even if you read this book and find it is not for you, it will certainly provide food for thought.I found the content that spoke directly to healing damaging patriarchal, capitalist and racist systems (insidious in W.E.I.R.D. societies) super beneficial. I will refer back to this book whenever I perceive a potential disconnect between my parenting and my values.I can’t wait for a book number 2!

Audible.title: Beware citizens of the world
Audible.body: History repeats and I feel the world is yet again facing a perilous onslaught of dangerous far left agendas all converging at once. Cancel culture and woke culture are amongst a variety of groups that have sinister groups backing them. How spoiled are the youth of today, a generation who have never had it so good, yet complain about how unfair life is and how unjust things can be. I say grow up and give thanks to those who walked before you that had something to actually complain about, where injustice was real. This book lays out in broad daylight how tyrannical govt can be and how easy it is to wake up and it’s... too late. Smarten up as this book should be a reminder to never get complacent. I appreciate you making this available and hope all of humanity get the opportunity to read it. With thanks and appreciation.

Audible.title: Complete rubbish
Audible.body: I guess I shouldn’t have had such high expectations but really you would think that by 2022 you could be excused for thinking that apps should just work. This has to be the worst app I’ve ever downloaded. Why can’t you use credits to purchase in app? Why can’t you purchase credits in app? Why is there no link to purchase from search? Why do items I have finally figured out how to purchase say they’ve gone to my library but don’t show in my library in app? Why does the player freeze? If you’ve ever been worried about being ripped off through an app then don’t use this one! The selection of books cannot be beaten but this app is simply useless. I hope the designers have been arrested tied up and receive a sound thrashing every day for the pain they have inflicted on so many. Absolute asscrack. You even get forced to give a one star review even if you want to give none. Don’t use this rubbish!

Audible.title: ALL BLACKS Passion in WORDS
Audible.body: Thanks so much to all who endeavoured to put All Black history into such a magnificent book. I was genuinely sad to reach the end. Having moved to NZ from Canada in 2007, I first fell in love with the game watching them play SA in a little pub in Ohakune where so many fans packed the room, it felt like when Canada played Russia in ice hockey. It was there that I first saw grown men fly through the air to victory. I watched sportsmanship that saw the foulest call by a ref, not even register distain on Richie McCaw’s face because he was already getting in position for the next play. There was a physicality to the game but there more skill than I’d ever seen on field of any other game. This book puts into words the journey we all took while Sir Steve Hansen was at the helm. It will always be topical for the game and whether you played or are a fan, you will find it FASCINATING!!!

Audible.title: Essential reading to get understanding.
Audible.body: This my third listen to this narration in the last two months. What Mike reveals is too much too absorb in just one reading just as much as Scripture itself. We can never exhaust the depths of The Word our Heavenly Father has given us it is a lifelong study we dare not undertake. Only scholars like  Mike can open up the depths of Revelation in the language of The Word. He was a man raised up and empowered to bring to us who are willing to make effort Mike has lifted my understanding a 1000fold in this year alone. I am 82n years old and still willing to be taught, and our Heavenly Father is enabling me to learn despite my poor education and limited skills. Please i exhort all who seek to know absolute truth do read this book and meg the God of all Creation bless you with understanding as He has me. 🙏 Rob in New Zealand

Audible.title: Audible
Audible.body: Fantastic app, I found concentrating in reading very difficult after a major illness and then discovered audible. I credit this site with helping me on the road to recovery as I was no longer bored. Now I am well I can read on the car, getting ready to go out, even before I sleep. Put on the timer either minutes then off to sleep. Can download anywhere , anytime. Always have your library with you. Still the best app. Have been using audible for 5 years. Excellent plus they do listen to us and improve the app. A year later and still the best app.A fee more years of using Audible. I paint in my spare time and find listening to books and painting are the best companions. It is great to do two things I love at the same time. Keep up the good work. 😀😀💜

Audible.title: Good content, very marginal access to it
Audible.body: I have recently just trialled audible, found a book series I enjoyed listening to. However after finishing the book, and deciding I will happily pay for the next in the series. I discovered that I have no ability at all to buy more credits or anything outside of the 1 book a month. From my perspective my first months use has dried up in a matter of days and the apps inability to allow me to purchase additional books, means that audible from my experience, is largely redundant for most of the monthly duration. I’m not talking about wanting more for my money, simply the ability to spend more of my money in order to continue with a series I enjoyed, seems counter productive to a business, to restrict and limit you ability to spend money in their products or services.

Apple Music.title: Delayed
Apple Music.body: Hello, the only problem I have with this app is whenever I play the DW album by Ariana Grande, almost every song that I play on that album she ends up coming in early, or the music is really delayed, or they end up not even singing the words at all. And it’s specifically this album I haven't had a problem with this when I play another artists song or any one of her other albums. For example when I played ‘leave me lonely’ Macy gray at the being is supposed to say ‘dangerous love, your no good for me darling’ but what I end up hearing is ‘love, you’re no good for me darling’ another example would be ‘Bad decisions’ at the start of the bridge when she sings it’s heavily delayed and the music in the background ends up delaying like 4 seconds, and it is so off. Again I really do like this app but that’s the only problem I noticed and for some reason only that album. It could just be my phone but idk is this happening for anyone else? (Also many of the lyrics in some of the songs I listen to are way off 💀) It is not fixed

Apple Music.title: Apple deleted myPlaylist
Apple Music.body: I tried the trial subscription of Apple Music that I received with a Samsung purchase. I had Apple Music playlist on my iTunes, iPhone, and iPad that was in created over many years prior to the activating the trial subscription. I let the subscription expire and found out that all my playlist had been deleted from my Apple Music iPhone, iPad and TV apps. Also, my Apple Music app on my TV, which prior to the subscription would play music in my Apple library, now no longer accesses my playlist or any songs purchased and downloaded without re-signing up for a subscription. So Apple Music on my TV is useless at this point without a subscription. My Apple Music playlists on my iPhones, TV, iTunes, and iPad was deleted, literally erasing hours of work. I did figure out that I could re-sync my iPhone and iPad devices with iTunes on my computer and get the playlists back. However, my Samsung TV Apple Music app now requires a subscription to access my library to access previously purchased songs and playlist. This is incredibly non-customer service oriented. I also did a trial of the Apple TV subscription and Now, I’m concerned about what Apple may do to my Apple TV movies when that subscription expires. I guess I should have just left it alone and not signed up for the trial subscription. I would be better if you were warned when starting a trial subscription on the TV app and ending it will cause you to no longer be able to access you library.

Apple Music.title: Bad Connectity
Apple Music.body: This app would be good if it could stay connected. Very often you have to hit play once or twice a song to keep it going, which is extremely cumbersome when you’re listening to music in the shower or running; you have to stop what you’re doing every few minutes to keep it working. When out walking it holds a connection for about half an hour and if you skip more than 3 or 4 songs it completely quits loading. I’m in the greater Phoenix area and the cellular signal is great. This model iPhone is less than 2 years old, this shouldn’t be happening. The service is so jenky it’s almost not worth paying for anymore. Sticking to playlists instead of stations helps, but it would better if the app could just operate like it’s supposed to.Also the algorithm has trouble gauging what to play next. It’s like it can’t tell that you’re listening to all up beat, fast music and slow music is skipped, it just keeps pushing slow music. When I get off work I like to go running, at the same time every day I look for upbeat music to put myself in the mindset. It would be great if the algorithm could pick up on that and suggest more accordingly. The pop station is probably my favorite but it takes a lot of skipping and hitting play to keep it going, and at best it’ll only work part of the time. It’s almost easier to just turn on the radio.

Apple Music.title: Spatial Audio
Apple Music.body: My experience with this is 50/50 are good adaptions verses poor. Aside from that, when it's good it's extremely enjoyable. However, my gripe is with finding the music. Firstly, it's great Apple pays artists more to record this way. It would be a win/win situation except for actually finding the music in the catalog. I surmise that aside from the artists getting paid better, this also gives them store front exposure. For artists with older offerings it rekindles interest in their work. However, with the exception of playlists Apple has put together, many of these recordings remain buried … often with no description of them being done in Spacial Audio or double copies of the same recording. Sometimes you can find a whole Album if you root around but you must continually be persistent especially when only one song by an artist is done this way. The existing Search function is no help either. This is unfair to artists and makes finding content tedious and time consuming. This does not encourage people to adopt this newer way of listening. When one considers the minority of people who many have the equipment to take of advantage of this, it seems counterintuitive to have speed bumps encumbering discovery.

Apple Music.title: Bring back the option to organize album by “recently added”
Apple Music.body: This has been a great app, but for a new change: Apple removed the option to organize your albums in your library by “recently added“ and now you can only organize them by the title of the album or by the artist name. Why you would remove an organizational option makes no sense to me, but it is basically made my library seem completely unrecognizable to me (of course, technically they are organized, but they are organizing a way that is completely different from what I’m used to). The organization I am used to is gone, and all the albums seem completely mixed up. I have always used the “recently added” organization feature to organize my albums, and I know exactly where each album is supposed to be. However, now, my album completely out of my usual order. Please add that feature back in. Again, it makes no sense why you would remove an organizational feature. It’s not like you’re forcing people to use that option, they can use it if they like to. However it not being there is extremely frustrating, and I’ve begun looking into ways to transfer my library to another service if this can’t be fixed.

Apple Music.title: Update for 8-4-23 is awful
Apple Music.body: This update has completely messed up they way I use my playlists. I have a main playlist I use to get to my favorite songs faster. There are a lot of songs in this playlist and I tend to want to listen to th new ones over th ones I’ve heard too many times. I usually organize th playlist from newest added to oldest because th newly added songs always go to th bottom of th list and always have and I have never figured out how to tell it I want new songs at th front. Now after years of adding songs to th end and just sorting th playlist from newly added to old this new update has made all my new songs added to th front. What this boils down to is now I have to drag a newly added song to th very bottom or th very top of my playlists because all my newly added songs get put right by th older ones. I like to keep my playlist in an order cause this playlist I’ve had over a decade so it has thousands of songs by now as u can imagine I don’t listen to th old ones often but it’s good for shuffle all at th gym or something active. Now any newly added song to this playlist is forever separated from th rest of my newer songs and thrown right to th older songs. This is something that did not need to b fixed so please apple just stop.

Apple Music.title: The best music platform, but I have an issue
Apple Music.body: I'm not switching from this music platform. I mean the sound quality, amount of songs to listen to, etc. But for about 6 months now, I've been having this problem. When I add a song to a playlist, it won't add the songs even after the notification pops up saying "Blah blah blah has been added to Blah Blah playlist" and so I add the song again to the playlist, it says the notification thing again and then it finally adds the song to the playlist but since I had added it already before it adds 2 at the same time and then I have to edit and delete one. It's not the worst thing but it's really inconvenient when I'm trying to quickly add songs to a playlist. I have noticed it doesn't do this glitch when I click to add a whole album to a playlist at once. I'm just hoping they fix this glitch. But really other then that their is zero problems. Once again I'm not switching music platforms and it really does have good sound quality, lots of song selection, etc.

Apple Music.title: Why There Need to be a Resume Shuffle Button:
Apple Music.body: Shuffle mode does not shuffle. I have over 500 songs on one of my playlists—which I have been listening to for years—but the same twenty songs are repeated every time I shuffle. Why are many of my songs not being played at all? There’s a reason why I add each song to my playlist: I like them all!  Is there an algorithm that causes this? If so, I have attempted to counteract it by clearing all histories. Also, none of the songs are on repeat mode, so this is not the problem. I am not sure what more to do; this is very frustrating, and I have talked to other users who share the same issue. Could there be an option to where every song must play, no matter how many times I shuffle, before being repeated? This may sound dumb because one would assume that I should merely stop pressing the Shuffle button and resume the last song played, but in order to access other Apple Music appliances and play other playlists, this is not plausible. Therefore, there should be a new button: Resume Shuffle!! This in addition to the already Shuffle button (so users can still mix things up), will create a much more enjoyable experience on Apple Music!! I am certain that other users will agree with me.

Apple Music.title: Playlists need a LOT of work
Apple Music.body: I don’t know about others, but my enjoyment of a music app rests highly on the abilities of its playlists. In this regard, Apple Music is a failure. First, there is no option to search globally within all playlists at once - this makes it impossible to quickly locate a song, which should be a basic function. This also makes it impossible to find duplicate tracks within your playlists. Second, there is no option to delete multiple songs within a playlist at once - it has to be done song by song, which is absurd. No option to delete multiple albums at once, either. What is Apple’s aversion to letting the user do this? Third, when you are playing a song, there is an option to “go to album” but no option to “go to artist,” which is irritating. Apple Music looks great and sounds great, but it’s not user-friendly in the way it needs to be. Right now, I’m only using it because it comes free in a family plan from a relative. The convenience and functionality simply is not there. To the developer: pay attention to what your users are telling you. You do not know better than we do what options we want. Details matter.

Apple Music.title: Less User Friendly
Apple Music.body: Latest update has taken a fine app and simply made it less user friendly. Among other issues, the main two problems are the complete loss of the scrubbing ability and the ‘previously played’ and ‘up next’ features of the app. The ability to scrub through songs has just been removed, replaced only with a volume slide bar which is about as unnecessary as it gets, I’d prefer a return to the old format here. For the playlist feature, when you press the song being played and the previously played and up next songs pop up, the top of that screen is too close the activation area for opening the notifications slide down page. The result is that whenever I’m attempting to close the playlist page by sliding it down, I open my notifications page - simply less user friendly. Please restore these features to their older formats and have a few more trial testers before releasing this sort of failed update.Additionally, when I click the suggest less songs like this, the button should simultaneously function as a skip song button. Why would I ask the system to suggest less songs like that and continue listening to the song? Pandora had this figured a decade ago.

Apple Music.title: Best music app
Apple Music.body: You can download music videos, play music with Siri, and so many, all you have to do is just pay 10$ a month, I say it is worth the experience, you can download so much music, it even clean versions, which are great, I say it is worth it, and the best app for music, my favourite, after struggling to find free music, I just got myself an apple gift card, and got a sub rip toon, and I got 3 months free, I absolutely love this app

Apple Music.title: Better than Spotify
Apple Music.body: Bug Report:When adding several songs in a row to a playlist, some songs will not add right quite regularly

Apple Music.title: Download issue
Apple Music.body: After the new 15.02 update its hard to download songs on full resolution. Sometimes the songs stop playing after 15 seconds and its tough to download songs. Also, it glitches and stops playing songs if it is not downloaded

Apple Music.title: Switching back to Spotify
Apple Music.body: Lagged on my computer, poor suggestion of songs, literally my taste in music dropped after switching from Spotify to Apple Music.

Apple Music.title: Why Did You Delete My Music?!?!
Apple Music.body: I’m a huge music lover with an extensive playlist. It took me multiple hours of the course of a few days too add and download over 900 songs, after about a week or two of using the app almost all my music DISAPPEARED. I woke up one day and had only 126 songs left on my account out of over 900… 800 songs just disappeared, I’m extremely disappointed and frustrated. Downloading Spotify instead!! If I could give this review 0/5 stars I WOULD

Apple Music.title: I need to redownload my music
Apple Music.body: When i wake up my music says it isnt downloaded when i downloaded please help whats going on it never happen like this

Apple Music.title: Apple can do a lot better than this
Apple Music.body: You pay a premium amount and download songs yet when you don’t have WiFi connected, downloaded songs do not playThe most annnoying is when you change region the content automatically disappears, now you have to start searching for songs, setting up new playlists. If I could give it zero I would.

Apple Music.title: Review
Apple Music.body: This is not a good app I was using it and it deleted all my songs and playlist

Apple Music.title: New IOS update trash
Apple Music.body: No way to review the update so here ya go apple… why you get rid of the old wallpaper and have such a limited selection now??? You supposed to get better, not the complete opposite… very disappointed with apple and all it’s product and service(s)… especially Apple Music, the radio is Better at saving my music than apple is… two thumbs down apple 👎👎

Apple Music.title: Due to distribution rights music isn’t available everywhere
Apple Music.body: So basically if you’re in Canada you can’t listen to certain songs that are readily available outside your country very disappointing

Apple Music.title: Great, a suggestion
Apple Music.body: I love Apple Music, have been using it for years as my main music streaming service. Super clean and easy-to-use interface, simple format to make playlists and discover artists etc, I love it. Definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a new service. A suggestion I have is to be able to see how many times you have listened to a song. I know on the laptop/pc version this is available, but since I mainly use Apple Music on mobile this would be super convenient. Especially as the music usage doesn’t always sync, making the statistics less accurate for the non mobile devices. Perhaps this could be integrated into the sort function or in the drop down menu that shows up when you press and hold on a song. Either way, I would love to see this feature added.

Apple Music.title: NOT HAPPY!!!
Apple Music.body: Been using Apple Music for years but today I noticed an huge error with playlists in this music App. After updating to the new iOS 15.4.1 (on Sunday); today (Tuesday) I went to play my regular playlist and noticed that HALF of the songs (from the top to the middle) was deleted out of the playlist! I never change the order of the songs and I don’t never like deleting songs out either. About 50 to 100 songs just disappeared out of that playlist but only after updating to the newest iOS. THANKFULLY they are still purchased and in my library still! But it’s going to be extremely frustrating putting every single song back and trying to remember each placing. This error has never happened in the entire 10 years I’ve used the Music App/Apple iPhone. There is also no possible way for anyone to take over my iPhone at any time so I know that it’s not that.Is there anyway I get the data back from the a few weeks ago? I do not use iCloud and I synced/updated my data to another device before noticed that the iOS removed half the playlist. P.s: I noticed that skipping through the songs now is INCREDIBLY laggy! It takes more than 2 seconds to skip through. Even through just 2 songs and back.

Apple Music.title: Not happy.
Apple Music.body: As a user of iTunes since 2005 (previous products much longer) and having around a 100gb of Music, I feel qualified to give fair critique, I think it’s disgusting that albums paid for in full seem to have a shelf life (depending on I’m guessing licensing agreements) Apple fails to notify of these changes and when attempting to listen to these albums sometimes at a much later date, it now says not available in your country or region, it was available when you sold it to me though and I downloaded but now isn’t available and the downloaded also disappear, I see this as theft, and considering Apple now has us locked in, I mean obviously once you have built a substantial music library (and movies etc) leaving for a different or maybe better product becomes unrealistic because of the costs of replacing your whole library, not just the device,  I’m tired of these silent but real standover tactics of Apple (and other corporations). The truth is it’s really bad service because we older and long term customers are the founding customers who built your business, the fact you don’t recognise that and pretty well treat us how you please is disgraceful.

Apple Music.title: Sound Quality
Apple Music.body: I have an iPhone 11 Pro Max, still in perfect condition no issues with it at all, Best Phone I have ever had since the iPhone 6Plus! Recently towards mid November 2023 I updated my phone to the most recent IOS as you do with Apple products. I had only recently as well subscribed to My Music making it the first time I’ve paid for songs on my phone no issues. Sound was great Bluetooth in the car music is great loud bass everything perfect as you would expect for paying for this service. However, after upgrading to the latest IOS streaming music now in my car has been horrible the sound quality is low, no bass no more have to put my car volume to full to even hear the words of any song now. Initially I thought maybe my Bluetooth was playing up, nope. Turned my phone off and restart re-downloaded music app nope still same issue. I then stream music from another free app and it was playing like how My Music use to play. Apple please fix this, I don’t want to cancel I love that every song is available I just the quality to return please I don’t even know what happened please fix

Apple Music.title: Sing option
Apple Music.body: Beautiful app with great exclusive features, however, I noticed the song feature was stripped from my device (IPhone XS Max), before the software update and application update I had this feature. Now I notice on the Apple website that it is only supported from IPhone 11+. A bit disappointed this feature was removed from my mobile device and was curious on why it was, however, does not change the main opinion of the application. Great interface and the exclusive audios and features within songs that are only available on Apple Music and not on other streaming platforms make the experience of switching enjoyable and immersive with the content.

Apple Music.title: Baffling app design
Apple Music.body: This app is very poor, especially compared to Tidal. When I first started with Tidal, it’s library was modest, but now it is Apple that is lagging, at least with artists that I like. The Apple Music app is not intuitive. It is hard to find music- it’s easier to find music in the ‘Sleep’ genre than Jazz! I gather that their song/artist recommendations are poor too (in Tidal they’re excellent). Your ability to customise your home screen is non existent. For example, why do I have to see ‘kids corner’? For someone who doesn’t have kids (or who wants to but cannot) this is annoying/depressing. The creators of the Apple Music app seem obsessed with playlists. It’s easier find out what other people are listening to (top charts, curated playlists etc) than to find things that I like or might be interested in! It is bizarre!Speaking of bizarre, my library has artists and albums from iTunes days, and newly favourited albums. But newly-favourites artists? Oh no, sorry they’re under the ‘listen now’ section. So despite innovations like the expansion of Lossless and the addition of Spatial Audio, it’s still junk. It’s like selling some of the best ice cream in the world from a recently used abattoir that has a dubious hygiene record. Hope this helps others’ decisions.

Apple Music.title: Spam pop up Ads - Is this really run by Apple
Apple Music.body: Apple Music ads are now running as spam pop-ups that take you to the subscribe page when you click to close the spam ads in all kinds of games that normally have the dodgiest of ads - like Zynga’s Words With Friends.Many of Zynga’s games have been proven to be types of gambling in disguise, where the players can not win real-world fiat currency (money), but can easily lose hundreds of dollars a week by being baited by their apps to buy all kinds of worthless digital products in order to win the live online anonymous player games.They abuse psychology, including child psychology with games available to young children to fill their coffers with every increasing billions in profits from vulnerable people and the young and innocent alike.Is Apple’s senior management aware that the likes of Apple Music’s marketing team are in cahoots with such low lives?

Apple Music.title: Couple of suggestions.
Apple Music.body: 1. Search function is way too specific. I thought Apple would get this right by now. Literally copy + paste Spotify’s search system: keywords, misspelling and partially correct searches should show ALL returned content and sort by popularity, with popular content at the top.2. Create a “remove from current playlist” function in the hold menu of any song in your queue that is playing from the current playlist. Another simple one that would make all the difference, saves scrolling through a playlist for a song that shows up that shouldn’t be there.3. Content in “My Library” used to show up instantly in search, now there’s a delay like it’s scanning some sort of online database. Not a big issue but just wondering what changed?

Apple Music.title: Can’t even save a radio station?!
Apple Music.body: Can’t save radio stations?  Even my $50 car radio in the 80’s could do that. But a $2550 iPhone with an Apple Music subscription can’t? Welcome to 2024 where you have to search for your radio stations every time. Does anyone else feel like me that your old stereo was more fun & intuitive to use. Finding stuff seems like too much effort to me. In the old days I could pinpoint a cd/dvd/tape etc on my shelf in seconds. This feels like a tech downgrade. Wish I could better put in words but feels like everything is hidden. Maybe we need to bring back skewamorphic design? Not sure but would be good if I could use my eyes more than having to rely on my memory. It’s actually what I hate about most modern tech

Apple Music.title: Not designed as a personal SONG librarian
Apple Music.body: Some people just want a good flexible easy to use software, ability to transfer songs and arrange playlists between their multiple devices, unfortunately this is not a great choice as it does not allow you to load songs or manipulate your playlists on portable devices, it has serious restrictions which makes this software useless or very hard to persevere with.No lyrics display editor on portable devices, no easy and logical way to transfer data between devices i could go on and on.Stage traxx 3 is a much better program to use if you need a very powerfull librarian, replay software with great lyrics display and editing, song chords if you happen to be a musician and loads more features to help you manipulate your music.MUSIC you need a good look at yourself, keep up with real peoples needs and wants.

Apple Music.title: Sorting according to Alphabetical order
Apple Music.body: It will great to have a alphabetical sort order within your playlist. This way duplicates can be removed if same song has been saved for the same artist. The search function within the same playlist does not show correctly when the artist name is typed. I have Jimmy Ruffin song of 2 versions. When I type Ruffin it shows only 1 of the songs. In Apple TV when I goto the bottom of the playlist and select a song, it starts playing the first song. This has happened very often. Exiting/closing the Application makes no difference. Is there a limit to the number of songs within a playlist. Currently I have more than 800 songs added to a playlist.

Apple Music.title: I do not recommend this service as there are many issues
Apple Music.body: 1) No mechanism to provide feedback and report issues via the app. 2) No way to search for items in your existing playlists in online or offline mode - this is a significant limitation. I don’t recommend subscribing to Apple Music if you have a large collection of music and wish to play specific songs - you will have to scroll through 100s of songs yourself to find the one you want to play. 3) Cannot use Apple Music when connected to an external monitor. When connecting via USB-C to an external monitor on an ipad, the only option is to play the music on the external monitor (no option to play the music via the built-in speakers on the iPad itself). This is not a good decision as the developers are forgetting that many monitors do not have speakers. This renders the Apple Music unusable. Quite an oversight considering that the docking functionality of the iPad is targeted at productivity applications.

Apple Music.title: Good bit won’t download my songs
Apple Music.body: I have had this app for a long time and it’s really good. When I’m at home with wifi I tap to download the songs in my playlist but it doesn’t download. Today I tired to listen to a song thats not in my playlist and I waited like 10 minutes for it to play and it didn’t play so I went to my playlist and it only played certain songs that were downloaded so I tapped the download button but it didn’t work, it was like what it’s like when I don’t have wifi but maybe that’s just my phone because I have an iPhone 6s.

Apple Music.title: Decided: never will give Apple 1 more cent
Apple Music.body: Apple won’t allow me to even play my own music. This is extremely stupid. I paid the blood price for this stupid device, knowing they will make it hard to use efficiently. I said to myself “is ok, it might take 10 extra steps to copy my own files into it, but then I can play them” or “it might be extremely hard to get a picture out of the camera, but camera isn’t that bad”. Anyway, now I cannot even play the files. Apple executives might be saving up to see if they can afford to live slightly longer greedy lives, as they fear for the extremely selective and cautive circle of hell that awaits for them. By the way, the battery is doing its best to force me to go back to ANY other phone, by depleting itself like there’s no tomorrow. And I swear for the old gods and new: I will never buy another Apple product.

Apple Music.title: WOW! 5 Stars!
Apple Music.body: Apple  Music is probably my favourite music app ON EARTH! Apple music has a wide variety of songs of different genres. It does need wifi, but if you download your songs, you can listen with absolutely no wifi. You can my playlists and it plays all of the songs in the playlist going from one to the next. Another amazing feature is that you can make songs play over and over again without you clicking it over again. In my opinion, Apple Music is such a great app and I think you would enjoy it too.

Apple Music.title: Prefer the clean experience
Apple Music.body: I’ve dabbled with Apple Music and the competition and always end up coming back. It’s clean and does music how I expect it. The app isn’t overloaded with extra features I don’t want to use and the experience is pretty stable. I like the lyrics and lossless quality. I also enjoy the curated playlists and the radio stations. I don’t think I’ll ever switch again.

Apple Music.title: The new
Apple Music.body: I don’t know 🤷‍♂️ why but I’m just really happy 😊 I’m happy 😊 happy 😊 thank for the kind words I hope 🤞 it will help a lot more people to get through it and I hope 🤞 to see your tweets too much and I’m glad to hear you have some fun and good times with your family too and I hope you get well too much too soon too soon too soon too I love 💕 🤣

Apple Music.title: iOS 16.4.1 - Terrible for Apple Music
Apple Music.body: Since iOS 16.4.1 there has been terrible delays in-between skipping songs and playing another song. There seems to be some invisible buffering whether or not it’s connected to the internet, even downloaded songs wont play for 10-20 seconds. When searching an Artist or Album, it won’t open when you click on it 🤷🏼‍♂️ I don’t know what you’ve done to the app but it’s the worst it’s been since it was launched and I’ve been playing for it since the start! PLEASE UPDATE ASAP!!!! It’s horrible and I pay for it and it won’t work properly

Apple Music.title: Check download songs
Apple Music.body: Everything is good and I love apple music. The only thing I want is to check the downloaded songs cuz sometimes it couldn’t play the songs when I am offline and it got stuck on the same song. If the carousel mode is still working that looks cool as well.

Apple Music.title: Apples way - or else
Apple Music.body: The usual Apple mafia-like Apple way of doing business this app is only useful if you subscribe to the music service.  I have a MacBook Air with iTunes playlists that won’t sync to the Music app on my iphone.  Apple are always trying to force or trick you into paying for their services, this comes at a cost of usability even for someone who owns two Apple devices.  The devices don’t connect easily through the iTunes-Music app without a subscription..  Good business for Apple but deeply cynical and disrespectful of its users.

Amazon Prime Video.title: subtitles are very finicky
Amazon Prime Video.body: This app is great:) There are so many included shows and i’ve had a really great time watching them. I’ve been watching Good Omens (excited for s2) and the legend of vox machina. however my only grievance is that the subtitles are a nightmare. You should have a setting to automatically keep them on. I’m not deaf or hard of hearing or anything however having the subtitles on really helps me understand what’s going on. It is really annoying to have to turn on the subtitles every-time i leave the app, or whenever a new episode starts (sometimes it works most of the time they turn off) I would really appreciate if there was just a setting to have the subtitles stay in for everything they’re available for. other than that the originals are great and the video quality is as-well, if you are also someone who relies on subtitles keep in mind that they can be very annoying at times.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Ads 👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎
Amazon Prime Video.body: The recent decision to include ads without paying the extra 35 bucks a year was disappointing. At the time I decided to get paramount + through prime channels. The ads were horrendous.  To the point that I decided to bite the bullet and pay the overloads their penance.  So paying the 2.99 didn’t affect the ads in the slightest.  And the ads weren’t positioned where the ad breaks are in the show. Middle of a gunfight boom 5 minutes of ads.  After painfully finishing 1883 I started to rethink everything. I canceled Paramount + and have considered canceling prime. Let me be clear. Ads are the worst and there is nothing more triggering. If I wanted to watch ads I can watch any of the free services with ads. If I’m paying nearly 200 dollars a year for a streaming service I’d better not have a hint of an ad.  I will try subscribing to paramount + in the future through Apple TV. But if it has ads as well I might have to leave Paramount behind. The idea of buying shows seems like a much better idea at this point. Not much discovery but my generation hates ads.  Buying digital seems a scam as well even though it’s the most convenient. Scammy is the new game it seems.  If it wasn’t for Sheridan I’d leave paramount on the shelf.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Quite upsetting…..
Amazon Prime Video.body: The barrage of ads is not only unnecessary, but they are also at a greater volume point that the actual entertainment that I wish to watch.  It’s extremely difficult to endure as well as the option NOT to skip the ads.  The greatest disgust is that you will sync to play not one but two ads as well, depending on the chosen feature.  Your greatest inadequacy is your lack of formatting the Prime app to the Prime screen on my chosen device.   I will choose a certain show/movie to watch from the app and proceed to my form of viewing.  I will wait a few minutes before I switch on my TV before I settle in to watch, 5-10 minutes.  My recent selection is not shown in my chosen features to watch, even after a decent amount of time.  Which leads me to search for my title.  The formats must be consistent!!  I have actually become so bothered by not only the ads but the lack of cohesive formats!!!  Please, format both to sync and allow viewers to skip your ads as more than one will play at a time.Both issues an easy to adjust.  Please make an effort to do so.  It’s quite frustrating and has decreased my viewership.

Amazon Prime Video.title: 9.24 added bugs!
Amazon Prime Video.body: Purchased a lot of movies. The app still recognizes the purchase but My Stuff/Purchases will only display 20 titles. Resorting from recent to A-Z or Z-A will display a different set but again limited to 20.  Whoever thought that limiting purchase display list to 20 instead of being able to scroll though all purchases should be fired for incompetence. Tried to report but it sends you to a chat feature. After being bounced to several people, I got the standard uninstall and reinstall the app and restart ipad. Neither worked.  Tried to report again and once more bounced to several different people in chat. They seem to be unwilling to report as a new bug when they fail to solve the issue.  Their work around is to go to web address to access purchased movies/shows given My Stuff/purchases is broken. Alternative if you remember every purchase you can use search feature to find it and finally have the option to play.  No more purchases until they get this fixed. The work arounds are annoying and take more time when it worked before the update.F on the last update and D- on chat experience.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Not entertaining
Amazon Prime Video.body: I’ve been a prime video member since they started the platform, I have always been quite happy with there selection of movies and tv shows, however this last couple months I have been not only been paying for my subscription including paramount + but also seem to be paying for adds. I can’t watch any show with out getting bombarded with ad after ad after ad. This has been beyond inconvenient to me and my family. I feel that almost every platform has been not only charging for subscriptions but also charging companies to place there ads. In other words your double dipping your chip. And to make things worse, we have to pay more to go add free. This is completely unfair. If you are going to place adds then don’t charge for subscriptions and if you customers are paying subscriptions then don’t place ads. This is not fair to your customers and only goes to prove corporate greed. You need to fix this immediately for your customers before you lose a lot of us.

Amazon Prime Video.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
Amazon Prime Video.body: The worst company and the worst streaming app I’ve ever experienced. If I could give it negative stars I would. They very clearly have bots leaving positive reviews to adjust their rating because the internet is filled with others saying the same thing i am. The entire purpose of this app now is to force you into buying a dozen channels just to be able to watch any of the content. The UI is the worst of all the apps. None of the content I’ve purchased shows up as being mine when I search for it. Countless times it has tried to get me to purchase a movie or a season I ALREADY OWN. On top of that, if you search for a show/movie it will often make it seem as though it’s free until you start watching. Then that literal same video and any sequels (that were also listed as free) will suddenly cost money to watch. I’ve tried filing complaints, giving feedback, expressing concerns with customer service. Avoid this app like the plague, you’ll sign over the rights to every bit of privacy you have and in return you’ll be scammed out of your money and ignored by the company when you try to correct issues.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Rip Off- charges for shows on channels you purchase
Amazon Prime Video.body: Purchased Discovery+ subscription on my Prime Video account mainly for Expedition Unknown and am now being charged to stream it or can’t find the included version. Finding the shows the are included in my subscription or currently watched are too hard to find, however the same shows for purchase comes up first even when they are included in my subscription. This is a rip off. Why should the app charge you for shows that are included in your subscription? Why pay for the channel and this (plus others) that are included just to purchase what’s supposed to be included? Maybe this is a change but it’s too much work to look for what I’m already paying for. Also huge con that they don’t offer Peacock but I’m sure if I purchased their channel, it would be the same thing. Considering canceling as other streaming options can bundle more channels for a better price by the time you add all the subscriptions and don’t even get what’s offered without paying additional on top of the channel. Not worth it with other streaming options for me.

Amazon Prime Video.title: One word: ads on content
Amazon Prime Video.body: Like, I’d get it if it was a smaller or a free service. Honestly, it’d be fine. But having to wait for something to load then I can click skip so I can then wait for the show I wanted to watch to load after? And even worse, the app crashes a lot when I hit skip, or just kick me to the Home Screen of the app. And maybe it wouldn’t bother me as much if you didn’t constantly push paid-for content and makes it more difficult than it should to filter the shows included with subscription. While The Grand Tour and The Tick are easily some of the best shows here, the latter is a HUGE example of missed opportunity through the lack of pushing. Even buying and watching super hero and comedy shows before finding The Tick myself, it never once showed up in suggestions. And that’s one of YOUR shows that I couldn’t find until a YouTuber mentioned it existed, off hand, in a video about something else entirely. So many missed opportunity and problems within the app, and the ads are just the Cherry on top that made me wanna rant about my gripes with the service.

Amazon Prime Video.title: “A Haunting”
Amazon Prime Video.body: I love to watch paranormal shows and Prime has a lot of options…” A Haunting “ is a great example of the shows I watch.  I have no adds on my service, so idk if this is the problem when watching this show.  This is a very edge of your seat program,  the problem is, when it come toward the very end of every episode, Prime ends the program immediately after what would be the last commercial break, so I never get to see what happens at the very end.  UGH!! THIS IS SO FRIGIN FRUSTRATING!!!  It’s an awesome show and the end of it, I’m sure, would be incredible and not to mention the nformative. But I will never know what happens to the demons/spirits/residents or mediums/priests/paranormal investigators because PRIME DOES NOT SHOW THE END OF ANY OF THEIR EPISODES!!!!!PS if anyone reading this experiences this while watching other programs/shows, PLEASE write a review stating s.  Hopefully Prime will get the message and fix this frustrating bug!!!

Amazon Prime Video.title: TV App problems
Amazon Prime Video.body: I didn’t give a 1 star review simply because the content you have is great! I own an LG TV and a Vizio TV. When I attempt to use the app on my Vizio it just doesn’t load all the content and I’m unable to see what I’m clicking on. When it DOES manage to load I try and watch something it continues loading then a message pops up saying there’s a problem with the app and it prompts me to close the app. When I use it on my LG TV OS it works perfectly fine which is a nice change. Although when I use my Apple TV 4K 3rd Gen. it does the SAME thing my Vizio TV does! So I’m really frustrated to say the least with my recent experience with the Prime Video app. It’s NOT internet connectivity issues because both TV’s are connected with an Ethernet cable AND every other app on both TV’s work just fine. The model name for my Vizio TV is V555-JO1, I’m not sure if it’s a problem with this particular TV model or if it’s just a problem with the app in general. I’d really love some help with my consistently frustrating problem thank you!

Amazon Prime Video.title: Not available in your current location
Amazon Prime Video.body: The app itself is fine, it does what it’s supposed to, however, the content is a huge disappointment. Why on earth would anybody pay a monthly subscription for a steaming service that promotes amazing shows, only to prompt “not available in your current location”. Seriously, 90% of the shows aren’t available, what’s the point?! Thanks for the free month amazon, but even that wasn’t worth my time.

Amazon Prime Video.title: It’s ok
Amazon Prime Video.body: It’s good, but having Apple TV support would make this app/service way more useful!

Amazon Prime Video.title: Decent selection clunky app
Amazon Prime Video.body: The selection is decent and it has good variety but the app is clunky and hard to navigate. Would benefit from being easier to navigate and from a recently watched option.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Disappointed
Amazon Prime Video.body: Very disappointing selection for Canada. Definitely not worth the cost. The selection is very limited and you still have to rent or subscribe to different services within the app . Will not be renewing as there is not enough content to justify price when regular tv services offer more selection and content

Amazon Prime Video.title: Chrome cast
Amazon Prime Video.body: Please add chromecast support! I would use this service much more but I cannot use it unless on my phone. Many shows are on prime which aren’t available elsewhere, however, like Netflix the offerings for Canada are much less robust than those for the USA. Still my kids enjoy it. But I can only use this streaming service from my computer and even then is a tedious thing. Chromecast support would really help.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Needs chromecast support!
Amazon Prime Video.body: Browsed around content seems great but I need to be able to watch on my TV like all the other streaming video apps.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Like Netflix but worse
Amazon Prime Video.body: It’s nice to use from time to time, especially since it’s all included with our prime membership, but it is definitely lacking in many regards. The titles are limited and often older or low quality. The few higher end tv shows or movies that sneak on are extremely over advertised (I was seeing Jack Ryan trailers for MONTHS). I’m not sure if this is due to it being a Canadian account, but Canadian Netflix has plenty of options still. The app is clunky, but works good enough. The option to skip ahead or back with screen taps is nice. It’s a real shame that it isn’t compatible with Apple TV or chrome cast though.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Poor aspect ratio on 2018 iPad Pro 11"
Amazon Prime Video.body: The app aspect ratio has not yet been optimized for the 2018 iPad Pro 11” causing black bars to appear on both sides of the screen, with there being no way to make a video actually full screen. Netflix and YouTube have already optimized their apps weeks ago. Prime Video is lagging behind.

Amazon Prime Video.title: No watch history across devices.
Amazon Prime Video.body: Kind of pointless when you can’t view your watch history across devices and family members are not responsible or accountable for their viewing habits. Will return if/when this is addressed. I do not want to CONTROL the household through parental controls. I would prefer transparency instead. If I have to turn on restrictions, I can not justify paying for it.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Poor interface
Amazon Prime Video.body: It’s tough to re watch a t v show. When I open the app there is no way to continue where I left off and there are also more than one icons for the same show because each season has its own icon but there is no text indicating which season it is.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Amazing App but need’s an Edit Update
Amazon Prime Video.body: This is an awesome Streaming app. The massively wide variety of movie’s is very good lots to watch and experience and customer service is amazing. The only annoyance is navigating through the movie’s i have purchased and downloaded, having to scroll all the way down to watch the 1st part of a movie to then scroll all the way up to watch the 2nd part. Don’t get me wrong i have somewhat gotten used to doing it multiple times but if you guy’s could add an edit option to move movie’s to wherever you’d wish or have movie’s such as Back To The Future all together instead of having to find them everywhere else.I hope you can do this sometime in the future as I believe it would make me and alot of other customers very happy.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Updated review working now
Amazon Prime Video.body: Update: they fixed it so adjusting my review to reflect this so has gone from a 1 star to a 4 ⭐️ why u ask cause the menu in the app requires lots of clicks to go back to where u were so app still needs refining Running this app on my apple tv & u can see the preview video but as soon as u go start to watch anything on it u have sound but no picture yet if u pause & timeshift with the remote u can see the mini picture but the main whole screen is dark gray, updated app restarted apple tv box, restarted tv everything but this app still broken on apple tv. Now every other streaming app I have works fine ie netflix, binge, stan etc but this Prime one is broken so fix it plz. Thanks, I will adjust review when I see its fixed & working as it should.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Great way to survive winter.
Amazon Prime Video.body: Prime is a great service for people as it provides an amazing range of films and tv programs to engage everyone! I have watched whole runs of different series and discovered fabulous actors, writers and the values from the early 90’s to today. This also shows cultural and social changes especially for women, gay and trans people and how openly they were invisible or derided in scripts and how this changed over thirty plus years. Way to go Prime! As someone whose mobility is compromised and wet weather increases pain, Prime has made many a dreary day pass quickly. I also have Netflix, Stan, Disney and Apple courtesy of my generous daughters but I spend most of my time with Prime. Thank you for your great programming.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Good content, great value, basic app
Amazon Prime Video.body: Prime video usually gets 2 or 3 big new movies a month, has some good tv shows, and some AMAZING original content. It is fantastic value for money with a yearly subscription. The video is high quality with no extra charge for 4k. Unfortunately the app really lets it down. There is only 1 user account which makes watching shows more difficult if a family member watches the same show. There is no like/dislike button so the same content shows up even if you already watched it and content that you have no interest in shows in the recommended list. The recently added list shows the same content month after month. There is a lot of bad movies but there are some hidden gems in there, but the app makes it difficult to find. I highly recommend prime video, I just wish the app was better.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Slow and crashy
Amazon Prime Video.body: It’s a slow app and also crashy on a new Samsung tv. I always get oops something went wrong and then I have reset everything for it to work. Then if I ever airplay something and watch it on another tv it never stores what episode I watched up to. When I watch it from the app again it starts off from the beginning of an episode again. Also when a season finishes it doesn’t go to the first episode of the next season it just ends like there are no more episodes. The app is slow to load and slow to browse videos, the mixing in of paid movies is useless I pay for the content so only show me what’s available to me without paying another $30 to watch another season. Just be more like Netflix...show only the content we are paying to see, I don’t want to rent anything else!

Amazon Prime Video.title: This streaming service from a tech leader!!!
Amazon Prime Video.body: What a bummer of a streaming service!?!? Even if you can put up with the lacklustre content, the interface, both app and smart TV, is super underwhelming and extraordinarily mediocre. The mobile app doesn’t even let you drag through the timeline. The app in general doesn’t promote the latest content based on viewing preferences, it doesn’t curate content based on views, it doesn’t give you an option to rate content, the interface is extremely clunky where it goes to the home page when you hit back, and the list goes on…If you’re even planning to compete with other streaming services, now is the time to pull your socks up.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Disappointed
Amazon Prime Video.body: I was very happy with prime in the beginning but when I went to watch, for example: Chicago fire 9th season you couldn’t watch any more until you subscribe to that channel, problem is even if I did I still couldn’t get it in Australia so there’s no point. That’s just 1 program. They’ve done it for a few other tv shows. I’m on the verge of canceling my prime as there’s nothing more frustrating than been half way through a series and you can’t go further. No I’m on the lookout for an app that has them all without pushing the purse stings further. Better not to have any. Saves money and stress.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Account Suspended
Amazon Prime Video.body: Extremely dissatisfied with the service. I had contacted to customer service to recover my old account but no help from anyone. Instead they asked me to close all the accounts and reopen the account again. When i tried to reopen the account then it gave me an error stating the account already exist. This is bound to happen; however i contacted to resolve this issue now and another representative recommended some steps which eventually took me to square 1 again. At the end, the representative have asked me to create a new email address to overcome this. I did this too yesterday and today i see that the new account is locked as well due to misuse of account. This is extremely frustrating and disappointing. Can someone look into this ASAP??

Amazon Prime Video.title: Poor or no customer service when things go wrong
Amazon Prime Video.body: I had trouble with the sign on process and things went down hill from there. My account was locked, the system wanted verification of details done online but would not let me log in to provide the details as the account was “On Hold”.  No response to my email. No published phone number for Australia. After 2 days I found a contact phone number on an unrelated site. Two calls to the call centre and each time I received a template email with a request for a copy of a paper credit card statement.  I’m using a debit card so the online state has an account number rather than the card number. Really not worth the effort. Netflix was so much easier.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Paid subscription with ads???
Amazon Prime Video.body: This is not a free service, which is not my problem. My issue is that before every episode or movie you watch, an ad is played. This ruins the feel of being immersed in the content you are watching. If it was free then fair enough, play the advertisements. But we are paying to watch content on demand and should not have to watch an ad. Yes you can skip it, but it’s annoying to have to open the app to do so. Also, the subtitles are terrible. Incorrect words are often displayed and almost every caption is missing a space between two words. Some programs are dated incorrectly. A lot of content state they were made in 2020 but are clearly decades old.

Amazon Prime Video.title: X-ray is such a cool feature
Amazon Prime Video.body: I have held off getting prime and have had it a short while now and I thought to watch one of my classic faves. But whilst watching on my phone on the bus I come across the X-ray feature which added more entertainment value to my movie. In the trivia section It shows continuity mistakes, facts behind quotes, inspirations for costumes and characters. A lot more valuable than Netflix or Disney.

Amazon Prime Video.title: 0 stars!!!!
Amazon Prime Video.body: So I live in NZ, I used the 1 week trial, and cancelled it because it wasn’t that good... and they are still charging my card. I have tried to put through a email in their web form, and they have emailed back but the email address they emailed from bounces back every time I try to reply to it! I then emailed through the web form again to email me from an email address I can actually reply from, and they say I can reply to it, but again, bounces back. Can’t call their contact centre due to the ridicules international charges and they can’t call me. So my card is still getting charged for a service I do not use. I have no subscriptions in my account, and no cards added. It’s horrible. Don’t get it! Disney + and Netflix are way better

Amazon Prime Video.title: Prime Video - awesome platform, awesome price!
Amazon Prime Video.body: Love using prime video as it’s super affordable and has great shows, especially their originals - such as the Marvelous Mrs. Maisel (highly recommend!). Also obsessed with the X-Ray feature! My only problem is their small range of movies/shows; I hope we will see more classics and popular shows outside of their originals in the future. Not the biggest problem though, it’s absolutely worth getting their gold, like no other documentaries and shows you can find on here!

Amazon Prime Video.title: Minus a billion stars- I have paid my subscription but unable to stream
Amazon Prime Video.body: I have paid my monthly subscription, which is shown in my iTunes/iPad/iPhone account/settings and also on my bank statement yet I am unable to stream anything. Your app persists on insisting that I have to pay to watch. I ALREADY HAVE. I was charged on the 8th of June and payment has gone through. I will not pay twice. I have contacted apple support which gave me no help and have attempted to contact the developer of your pathetic app but have been unable to receive any assistance. I will cancel my subscription and stick to Netflix, Neon and Disney + at least these platforms don’t rip people off.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Ads ruin the experience
Amazon Prime Video.body: Firstly, the app itself is fine. We have no tech issues or bugs, ChromeCast works fine, etc. The content is decent, they have an okay range of shows, including a few favourites.But there is literally no justification for playing ads between every episode. This is a paid subscription. If I pay for the service, and tell it what I want to watch, it should *NOT* then force an advertisement for some other show on me.The ads are skippable (this is new since I last had the app a couple years ago), but this is a big hassle on ChromeCast as you’re not sitting there with the app open waiting for the ad so you can skip it.Maybe play ads once someone’s show has ended so they can find something else, but not before playing the show I literally just asked to be played. The whole point of Streaming is to watch what I want when I want to, and I’ll stick to Netflix if this app continues to shove ads where they don’t belong.

Amazon Prime Video.title: Customer support not helpful
Amazon Prime Video.body: I have been temporarily locked out of my account due to “unusual activity” don’t know what that means for a streaming site and when I emailed customer support they told me to follow on screen instructions and they will review and respond within 24h, they only instructions I can find is to contact customer support as I don’t have access to a computer and when I emailed them back asking what else I can do to unlock my account they haven’t replied… kinda frustrating as this is now my main streaming platform now I have no way of streaming tv shows and movies without creating another account

Amazon Prime Video.title: Where’s the rest?
Amazon Prime Video.body: Where’s Prince of Egypt? Where’s Joseph King of Dreams? NOT AVAILABLE IN NZ!!! I honestly hate this. The fact that you have limited content restricted to certain countries is so disappointing and I don’t understand it. I would not download this app unless it was free (which it is) You’re contents pretty outdated but would be great if you actually had stuff available in New Zealand 🇳🇿

Amazon Prime Video.title: Awesome app! Recommened
Amazon Prime Video.body: Tbh i only downloaded it so i could get the free skin for FORTNITE, then ended up browsing through it and actually ended up liking the movies and shows it offered. Could really do with some more current and recent year movies for sure but awesome app either way. And only for $4.50(NZD) a month so im not complaining. Would definately recommened espcially with the free trial available

Amazon Prime Video.title: Casting
Amazon Prime Video.body: There is no casting feature in mobile app to tv. As far I know so many people expressed the same feeling. The reason they are not using the prime is “no casting option”. If they want to watch a movie in Bigger screen then they have to connect their laptop with HDMI cable to TV. Nobody will continue that process every time they want to watch a movie. If you guys can add that option, there will be huge scope to increase the number of users.

Amazon Prime Video.title: No service assistance despite promises.
Amazon Prime Video.body: Streamed successfully for the first hour or two. Then almost without fail, no matter what the program being watched, the content would drop out into ‘buffering’ mode then give an error message, and stop completely.  Really, REALLY annoying.  Tried Customer Support, had to spend an hour going thru all the options we had already tried, no avail.  They promised to call back - but only did so, once, well after bedtime NZ time.  Despite efforts to reconnect with them, - silence.  Useless.    I have withdrawn my sub, needless to say.
